name: Achel Brewery
description: Achel brewery or Brouwerij der Sint-Benedictusabdij de Achelse Kluis is a Belgian Trappist brewery, and the smallest of the seven currently approved Trappist breweries. It is located in the Abbey of Saint Benedict in the Belgian municipality of Achel. It brews five trappist beers

name: Agassiz Brewing Company
description: Agassiz Brewing Company

name: Allentown Brew Works
description: The Allentown Brew Works is housed inside the historic Harold's Furniture Building at 812 W Hamilton Street. Years in the making, the new Allentown restaurant and brewery are part of the continuing vision of the Fegley family that established the original Bethlehem Brew Works in 1998. Proud to be part of the resurging downtown, the 400 seat restaurant is a testament to the vibrant heartbeat that thrives in this Queen City. Offering two and a half levels of dining, plus state of the art banquet facilities in The Hamilton Room, and multiple bars offering different atmospheres, as well as an outdoor casual Biergarten and a new seductive lower level lounge, Silk.

name: Baltimore-Washington Beer Works
description: Our beer was first conceived in Luxembourg between founders Stephen Demczuk and Wolfgang Stark.  Stephen was in Europe doing research in molecular biology and experienced its beer culture that lead to his mid-career crisis.  He started writing about beer, and then tried to open a brewery in Arlon, Belgium but that faltered.  He then formed the first beer-of-the-month club in Europe, Beer Around the World.  Importing beer into Luxembourg, boxing it up and shipping it within the EU.  One supplier of his beers was Wolfgang Stark of Haus de 131 Biere.  Wolfgang imported beer from all over the world. He supplied Ngoma from Togo, Flame from New Zealand, and Lapin Kulta from Finland.   One day Wolfgang asked Stephen if he would like to make a beer in Germany and using an American marketing theme.  It took Stephen just a second to say yes and a day to come up with The Raven.  The new company was registered in Baltimore and the new beer was eventually produced in Nagold, Germany and called in honor of Baltimore's Edgar Allan Poe The Raven Special Lager.

name: Barley Brown's Brew Pub
description: Small batch hand-crafted beer, good food, good company, good times...

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Monday - Saturday: 4:00 p.m. - 10:00 p.m.
Closed most holidays

name: Blackfoot River Brewing Company
description:
Blackfoot River Brewing Company was founded in 1998, and began producing their line of handcrafted beers in January of 1999. The Brewery is located in the heart of historic Downtown Helena and near the headwaters of both the Big and Little Blackfoot Rivers.

The founding partners established the brewery to produce the finest, handcrafted, traditional beers to be found in Montana. All Blackfoot River beers are brewed with the highest quality traditional 2-row malts, hops, and yeasts, individually selected to produce each particular style of beer. Each of our specialty beers are carefully handcrafted 14 barrels at a time. Blackfoot River's beers are never pasteurized, normally unfiltered and are available exclusively on draught.

Blackfoot River Brewing was founded and is operated by three partners:

Brian Smith -Head Brewer and General Manager
Greg Wermers - Off-Premise Sales
Brad Simshaw - Brewer and Regulatory/Tax Manager

Fourteen barrel, three-vessel, steam-fired brewhouse
(3) Fourteen barrel fermentation vessels
(5) Fourteen barrel conditioning/bright tanks
(3) Seven barrel conditioning/bright tanks
Packaging: draft
Capacity:1,850 barrels (annual)

name: Blackwater Brewing Company
description: The Blackwater Brewing Company is a family owned company. The company was formed in 1998 as a natural growth of a sole proprietorship, beginning with approximately four employees. Today we employ 13 local residents and continue to provide a family friendly environment for our patrons. The original owners, Terry Lee and Rosalinde Benson, continue to manage the daily operations here at Blackwater Brewing Company. Blackwater Brewing Company is currently divided into two divisions: food & beverage operations, and malt beverage brewing operations.

name: Blue Point Brewing
description:
Starting out in 1998 as two guys with a dog, a van, and a dream, Blue Point Brewing Company quickly became one of the nation’s premier microbreweries. After first launching our lightly toasted, complex, full-flavored Toasted Lager, we rapidly gained the respect of beer lovers far and wide. Soon after, we introduced several other brews and were being compared to breweries from noted craft-brewing capitals like Denver, Boston, Portland, and Seattle.

Brewing isn’t just our business, it’s our passion. We’re beer people. We started Blue Point Brewing Company because we wanted to make beer we would drink. To quench that desire, we select only top-quality ingredients and brew all-natural, unpasteurized beer. It’s this approach that put us on the world beer map. From the World Beer Cup to the Great American Beer Festival and the Australian International Beer Awards – we’re becoming noticed the world over. But we believe you should be the judge. Let us know what you think.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Brewery & Tasting Room Hours:
Thursday and Friday 3-7pm
Saturday 12-7pm

name: Brouwerij Den Hopperd
description: The Hopperd is a small craft brewery of organic beers. "Hopperd 'is an old Dutch word for hopped wort. Bart Desaeger - which in 1996 brought the first brew on the market - wants to use this name also indicate that he adheres to time-honored brewing traditions.

name: Butte Creek Brewing
description:
At Butte Creek Brewing, we handcraft award winning earth-friendly organic ales, pilsners, porters, and lagers. Since 1998, we have been a pioneer in brewing organic beers focused on quality, balance, and true hop flavor.

We support organic farming and promote sustainability in our community. We fight against global warming by reducing our carbon imprint. Enjoy a Butte Creek beer and support "The Official Beer of Planet Earth."

Handcrafted microbrews using premium malted barley and whole-cone hops. Certified by California Certified Organic Farmers (CCOF)

name: Cascade Brewing
description:
Cascade Brewing Company was established in 1998 by Art Larrance, who has been involved in Oregon's craft beer industry since its inception. Art co-founded one of the state's first microbreweries, Portland Brewing, as well as the Oregon Brewers Festival, which today is one of the world's preeminent craft beer festivals. 

Cascade Brewmaster Ron Gansberg got his start in the Northwest wine industry. He crossed over in 1986 and began an eight-year career at BridgePort Brewing Co., where he honed his brewing skills, then moved on to the equipment and engineering side of the industry. As Engineering Manager at BridgePort, Ron directed the design and installation of the 80 bbl brewhouse that is still in operation. 

Together, Art and Ron put their 40 years of beer experience to work, designing and installing Cascade's state-of-the-art 10 bbl brewing system in SW Portland, then creating and distributing well-balanced market-priced ales ranging from Pale Ale to Copper to Blond Bock. As the quality of the beer improved, they began to sell through distributors, increasing production to satisfy the wholesale market. 

Cascade Brewery is situated in the Pacific Northwest, a region renowned for its craft beers - the Portland metropolitan area has 42 breweries, more than any other metro area in the US, and is the nation's largest craft brewing market. Even though there are an abundance of breweries in this area, it's highly competitive. To stand out amongst this group, you need to push the envelope and be out there to get to your niche and magic elixir.

name: Central Coast Brewing Co
description: Serving the Central Coast's craft beer needs since 1998.  Enjoy are hand-crafted beers at the brewery or "Drink Local" at bars and restaurants all over the Central Coast.

name: Central Waters Brewing Company
description:
Brewing since 1998, Central Waters Brewing Company is built on the solid reputation of producing the finest quality beer in Central Wisconsin: Ouisconsing Red Ale, Happy Heron Pale Ale, Mudpuppy Porter, and many more.

Currently, Central Waters Brewing Company services over 200 retail locations in Central Wisconsin, and has expanded its product line to include 18 beer styles. Moving from Junction City to a new facility in Amherst, Wisconsin in January of 2007, Central Waters can better support the growing demand. CWBC continues to build on the solid reputation of producing the finest quality beers in Central Wisconsin.

name: Dragonmead Microbrewery
description: We strive to offer 35-45 different styles of beer on tap in our pub, including nitrogen-dispensed beers and two cask ales. We source all of our ingredients for each beer style from the country of origin. Our draft and bottle distribution market includes the entire state of Michigan. Final Absolution (Belgian Style Trippel) is our flagship and our most award winning beer. Our brew house is a three barrel system from Heavy Duty Products in Ontario, Canada. Last year we produced 2,400 barrels of beer. We also serve a small selection of meads and wines in our pub.  In November of 2013 we installed a brand new 20 barrel brew house fabricated by Craftwerk located in Michigan.  This new system will help us meet the growing demand in our state.

name: Franciscan Well
description:
The Franciscan Well Brewery was founded in 1998 on the North Mall in Cork City and is built on the site of an old Franciscan monastery and well dating back to the year 1219. Legend has it that water from the well had miraculous and curative properties, and people wold come from afar to drink from it.

The Brewery has combined modern technology with age old tradition in forming classic beer styles including lager, ale, stout, and wheat beer. All of the beers brewed at the Franciscan Well are natural, unlike some commercial beers that can contain chemical additives, preservatives and cheaper ingredients.

The Brewpub houses three serving vessels located directly behind the bar, which dispense our beer to the taps. The tanks, which hold 300gl each, offer the beer drinker a unique setting in which to enjoy our craft brewed beer.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Mon - Thu: 3:00 pm - 11:30 pm
Fri - Sat: 3:00 pm - 12:30 am
Sun: 3:00 pm - 11:00 pm

name: Ithaca Beer Company
description:
Ithaca Beer Co.,established in 1998, has a mission to brew delicious beers for the purpose of making life more enjoyable. We strive to make this company better and build our brand name and good reputation among our customers.

Over the last decade we have worked hard doing just that, and we have had lots of fun in the process!  From our friendly staff to the award-winning beer to our community outreach, Ithaca Beer continues to brew beers for the purpose of making your simple moments worthwhile.  Take a moment to look around our brand new site and learn about more about Ithaca Beer as a company, the beers we brew, and our involvement in Ithaca, NY.

name: Kuhnhenn Brewing
description:
Founded in 1998, Kuhnhenn Brewing Company began as a homebrew supplies shop in the family's former hardware store while buildout on the brewery was taking place. 

The company has been producing countless award-winning beer, mead, and wine out of their 8-barrel brewery since 2001. In 2012, Kuhnhenn took home the Gold Medal at the World Beer Cup in the IPA category for their flagship offering, DRIPA, or Double Rice IPA.

The brewery  has expanded to capacity over the years, with only limited distribution in Michigan, New York City, and parts of Europe, in addition to taking part in festivals throughout the world. Construction is underway on a production brewery and second taproom in nearby Clinton Township, which will allow the brewery to get closer to meeting demand by increasing capacity more than 1500% overnight. 

Visit the brewery taproom for to-go sales of some of their award-winning products.

name: Lengthwise Brewing Co
description:
Lengthwise Brewing Company was established in 1998 in order to follow the Great American Dream of turning passion into product. Initially, the creative partners divided their time between their "day jobs" and what is now regarded as Kern County's most popular micro-brewery. The production system includes a 14 Barrel Liquid Asset brewhouse and four 14 Barrel fermenters. Long hours and no pay almost never discouraged the inspired from taking a risk to pursue their heart's desire.

Childhood friends, Jeff Williams and Darin Schwicker, are transplants from California's Central Coast. Forged by a friendship of competitive swimming and unsuccessful fishing, the two vowed to create a brewed product "true" to their Lengthwise philosophy. Jeff's worldwide experience of designing and setting up breweries in such remote locations as the Caribbean, Ukraine, Russia and Japan certainly contributed to his vision for developing a brewery.

name: Mad Anthony Brewing
description: Looking for the best beer in town? Look no further my friend, Mad Anthony’s Brewery has got you covered. Grab a pint of our award-winning hand-crafted ales or lagers and kick back in one of our three locations. A cool, laid back atmosphere, full food menu, weekly live music, and of course an ever-changing menu of awesome beer is always in full swing. We offer one of the area’s best deep dish Chicago style pizzas, a variety of vegetarian selections, our now famous "Unwraps" and traditional pub fare. Whether you want something light, or are ready for a full meal, or need catering services for your next gathering, let us show you why Mad Anthony’s Brewery should be at the top of your list for fun!

locations.name: Mad Anthony's Lakeview Alehouse and Reception Hall
Mad Anthony's Lake City Tap House

name: Max Lager's Wood-Fired Grill & Brewery
description:
Max Lagers Wood-Fired Grill & Brewery Atlanta

Max Lager’s is the oldest independent brewery restaurant in Atlanta and is known widely for its wood-fired cuisine and freshly-brewed beers.

Located on Peachtree Street in the heart of Downtown Atlanta, Max Lager’s Wood-fired Grill & Brewery is an oasis of authenticity in an environment of national chains. The beautifully renovated 10,000 square-foot historic building features an industrial loft-style ambiance, and is designed to host fun events for groups of up to 700 people.

Max Lager’s was one of the first restaurants to bring the fresh and natural wood-fired menu concept to Atlanta. The art of cooking with wood enhances the Max Lager’s experience with bold flavors simply not found with alternative cooking methods. We feel that the investment made in the wood-fired grill is an investment that pays great dividends to our guests.

name: MicroBrasserie Charlevoix
description:
C'est au coeur de Baie-Saint-Paul, que sont brassées les bières d'inspiration belge "Dominus Vobiscum" Blanche, Ambrée, Double et Triple, ainsi que les bières "Vache Folle" ESB et Milk Stout.

Depuis maintenant 1998, les brasseurs charlevoisiens, ne cessent de laisser libre cours à leur imagination afin de satisfaire les amateurs les plus exigeants de bières spéciales. Depuis janvier 2009, les opérations ont été transférées dans de nouvelles installations plus modernes et plus efficaces permettant d’augmenter la capacité de production afin de mieux répondre à la demande.

Les produits de la MicroBrasserie sont disponibles dans les meilleurs restaurants, auberges et épiceries de la région de Charlevoix, ainsi que dans certains points de vente à travers le Québec.

name: Neptunes Brewery
description: A small brewery and tap room in Livingston, Montana that focuses on great beer, food and service. Don't drink like a fish, Drink Like a God!

name: New South Brewing
description:
We are a microbrewery in Myrtle Beach, S.C., producing 3000 bbls a year.

Supplying fresh ales and lagers to people living in and visiting South Carolina.

We now have Draft pours on Tuesdays, Thrusdays and Fridays at 4:30-7:00.  Free tours on Tuesdays and Thursdays at 3:00.

name: Panimoravintola Beer Hunter's
description: Finnish craft brewery and distillery located in the town of Pori.

name: Red Lodge Ales Brewing Company
description: Red Lodge Ales Brewing Company has been brewing fine craft beer since 1998. Our new facility is the largest Solar Powered building in the state of Montana, and our award winning beers are available throughout Montana, Wyoming, and North Dakota .

name: Rhodell Brewery
description:
Our bar carries 9 of our hand-crafted beers on draught and also one cask conditioned beer on a traditional British hand pump.

Our Scottish brewer brews over 30 different beer styles throughout the year, ranging from American style Wheat beers to Belgian Dubbels and Tripels and of course Scottish Ales.

Unlike other microbreweries - Our beers do not compromise on flavor!

name: Rochester Mills Beer Company
description: The Rochester Mills Beer Co. opened in 1998 in Downtown Rochester. Located in the historic Western Knitting Mill, the brewery is located on Water Street, just two blocks east of Main Street. Preserving the original character of the building, the brewery features original hardwood floors, columns, beams and exposed brick walls. The menu features a broad selection of eclectic American cuisine, all prepared with the freshest ingredients. From delectable appetizers, fresh salads, pizzas and pastas to delicious entrees and unique sandwiches, the menu has something for everyone and a kids menu is available. Special amenities include an outdoor patio, pool tables,  Greenhorn Music Night every Thursday starting at 9pm, and live entertainment every Friday, and Saturday nights starting at 10pm. The Martini Lounge is available for private parties.

name: Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery
description:
Our brewers eat, drink and sleep beer. They’re equal parts scientist, artist and beer geek. So, while every Rock Bottom brewer is passionate about their craft, they also put their own signature into every beer.

In other words, there is a unique beer menu at every Rock Bottom in addition to our core line up of consistent flavor profiles that you can expect at any Rock Bottom you visit nationwide.

But, you’re thirsty and want to know what beers you can expect down here, right?

name: Sebago Brewing Company
description: At Sebago Brewing Company we brew our beers from all malt. We use American grown 2-Row, caramel, chocolate, black, roasted barley and Munich malts from Briess Malting Company. Our grain silo holds 50,000 lbs. of American 2-Row Pale malt. We purchase our grain by the truckload and the bulk grain is blown into the silo from the grain truck. We use 75-80% of this grain in all of our beers. Then we measure our specialty malts into the mill. At this point we crush the malt so that the husk's are cracked open and the "meat" of the grain is exposed.

name: Sidreria Txopinondo
description:
Master artisan cider maker, Dominic LAGADEC follows a very precise method to develop his craft SAGARNO, literally apple wine. He is called the "Maître de Chai".

Our ciderhouse has a production capacity of about 26,415 gallons.

The kupelas (lightning) are maintained at a temperature of 53.6° F for an optimal preservation of aromas and the typical beaded Sagarno. They are made with chestnut or oak and have a capacity of 790 to 2,640 gallons.

Unique in the Basque Country, the ciderhouse has the distinction of being opened to guests during Txotx. In Txopinondo, the "Maître de Chai" opens the kupelas in agreement with the dishes you have chosen: TXOTX!

name: South Street Brewery
description:
The South Street Brewery was founded in 1998, and is housed in the renovated H. H. Hankins Hay and Grain warehouse built in the late 1800’s. Old brick walls, hardwood floors and thick timber pillars provide a striking setting for our custom built brewhouse and a spacious, welcoming atmosphere in which to enjoy our fresh, handcrafted ales and lagers as well as our seasonal fare.
Our commitment to on-premises brewing ensures that only the highest quality ingredients are used and that the beer is always fresh. This commitment has earned us regional and international praise but more importantly, results in a wide selection of styles and new, creative recipes that we hope will continually have our customers discovering new favorites.
Our menu also reflects our dedication to originality and fresh ingredients. We offer a seasonal menu as well as nightly specials, including an eclectic sampling of Contemporary American, Asian-Pacific, Continental, Creole, Caribbean and regional Southern dishes.
Our cuisine and libations are all served in a friendly, relaxed manner that challenges the idea that excellence necessitates pretense. We hope you enjoy your visit to South Street and that you return soon.

name: Thomas Creek Brewery
description: Since the beginning of the brewery in 1998, Tom Davis has been winning the hearts and taste buds of people all over the Southeast. His goal is to make the finest hand crafted beer, and please every beer lover that tries a Thomas Creek brew.

locations.name: Main Brewery

name: Tuckerman Brewing Company
description:
The Mount Washington Valley of NH's Local Brew. Offering four hand-crafted brews. Available in stores and restuarants in NH, MA & ME.

Tuckerman Brewing Co. brews our beer in the most green manner possible, using as many local ingredients and packaging materials as possible.

In 1998, Tuckerman Brewing Co. was founded with a love of the White Mountains of NH, in particular Mount Washington and the desire to create a fine hand crafted beer

name: Upland Brewing Company
description: We’ve been brewing ales, lagers, and sours in Bloomington, Indiana since 1998. Many of our brews are unique twists on traditional recipes, while others are products of our own imaginations. We’re proud to say that several of our beers have brought home national and international medals and awards, but what we really care about is brewing the kinds of beer we like to drink, and providing a fresh local option to our communities. It never hurts to get a pat on the back, though! Along the way, we’ve made lots of friends and drank our unfair share of good beer, all while trying to do good in our communities and do well as a craft brewery.
